column4: what is a good way to manage your wireless connection(s) in gnome?
we have a large ESS here, with many AP's with the same SSID, different channels.
i want a utility like with XP that will pick the strongest AP of that SSID and connect
just lists every AP that it finds
even if there are like 5 AP's with the same name, just on different channels.  it won't just pick the strongest one to show.  nor does it show signal strength at all
networkmanager should do it on dapper
it wants to install bind9?  won't this mess with my school's network?
i have no idea. i guess it won't if your school's network is setup even adequately
try the menu: system -> prefs -> themes
thats not for GTK and icons tho is it?
then yes, you can change everything there
theres an 'install theme' button.  what kind of theme is it looking for?  like what kind of file?  a GDM theme?  GTK theme file?
